Wish You Were Here: Vacation tips from fellow travelers Bay Area News Group readers Posted: 08/26/2015 03:00:00 PM PDT Updated: 08/28/2015 07:57:30 AM PDT MALAWI: Michaela Brody and Paul Benke, of Los Gatos, are just back from the Danforth Yacht Resort on Lake Malawi in Eastern Africa. This lake, the third largest in Africa, is the ninth largest in the world, Paul says. (Courtesy of Paul Benke) Courtesy of the Cheney Family ESTONIA: Walnut Creek residents Lynne and John Cheney spent 11 days on a Baltic cruise at the end of June exploring Oslo, Norway; Helsinki; Stockholm; St. Petersburg, Russia; and other ports, including Tallinn, Estonia (pictured). 
Travel tips: "The website cruisecritic.com was extremely helpful," Lynne says. "There is a roll call for all ships so you can find others who will be on the same cruise, as well as ask questions of those who have already been to the same ports. This website helped us decide which tours we wanted to do on our own, take the ship's excursion or book a tour with a private company." ESTONIA: Walnut Creek residents Lynne and John Cheney spent 11 days on a Baltic cruise at the end of June exploring Oslo, Helsinki, Stockholm, St. Petersburg and other ports, including Tallinn, Estonia (pictured). (Courtesy of the Cheney Family) Courtesy of Haley Grosenheider GREECE: Rodeo resident and San Diego State University student Haley Grosenheider traveled to Germany, Ireland and Greece this summer. "I took a creative-writing class in Paros Island in beautiful Greece for college credit," she says. "Such an amazing experience to study the craft in a place that has inspired some of the best artists in history. During my three weeks there, we had mini trips to other islands, including Santorini (pictured) for three days." Advertisement 
Travel tips: "If you go to Santorini, make sure to visit Oia to catch the most magnificent sunset you've ever seen. It's an event. Everyone gathers to witness the spectacle and applaud it once it has sunk! Hop on as many ferries as you can to different islands. Paros is laid-back with perfect beaches, Mykonos is known as the Ibiza of Greece, Santorini is picturesque -- every island offers something different. Soak up as much of it as you can!" Share your travels with us! Send your recent vacation selfies to jburrell@bayareanewsgroup.com . Be sure to tell us who's who, where they're from and where you are -- and include a couple of travel tips to help fellow readers globetrot, too.
